stanza.line: Music to hear why hear thou music sadlysadly
Sweets with sweets war not joy delights in joyjoy
Why lov thou that which thou receiv not gladlygladly
Or else receiv with pleasure thine annoyannoy
If the true concord of well-tuned soundssounds
By unions married do offend thine earear
They do but sweetly chide thee who confoundsconfounds
In singleness the parts that thou shouldst bearbear
Mark how one string sweet husband to anotheranother
Strikes each in each by mutual orderingordering
Resembling sire and child and happy mothermother
Who all in one one pleasing note do singsing
Whose speechless song being many seeming oneone
Sings this to thee Thou single wilt prove nonenone
